abstract.t: Being able to trust information from sensors and to securely control actuators are essential in a world of connected and networking things interacting with the physical world. This document summarizes known attacks, and show that just using CoAP with a security protocol like DTLS, TLS, or OSCORE is not enough for secure operation. The goal with this document is motivating generic and protocol-specific recommendations on the usage of CoAP. Several of the discussed attacks can be mitigated with the solutions in [I-D.ietf-core-echo-request-tag].
